str2: Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Endurable, tolerable. Comparative of a derivative of anechomai; more endurable.
Sodom. Plural of Hebrew origin; Sodoma, a place in Palestine.
Gomorrah, one of the destroyed cities on the Dead Sea. Of Hebrew origin; Gomorrha, a place near the Dead Sea.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
Decision; by extension, a tribunal; by implication, justice.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
